intro: Aiouea vexatrix, commonly known as the dark leaved hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, featuring dark green, elliptical leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Aiouea vexatrix is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
